page.title: 10Travel
page.content: Aircraft flying too low and noise were the factors mentioned by 75% of those interviewed. However the employment the Camp brings is appreciated. The general feeling was that a village shop would be an asset. Wattisham's village hall is too small to provide the leisure activities the people would like. A Youth Club and activities for the Senior Citizens figure prominently in the use of a new, larger hall. Although Wattisham has a strong Baptist element there appears to be a straight split between those who feel that the Parish Church of St Mary's Bildeston is justified in their fund raising for the costly restoration of the Tower and those who feel it should be raised for the Third World.
